articles.headline: No More Bench Strength
articles.snippet: For years, the idea of grooming a successor was a job requirement of a chief executive and a priority for a company’s board. But that is no longer the case.
articles.abstract: For years, the idea of grooming a successor was a job requirement of a chief executive and a priority for a company’s board. But that is no longer the case.
articles.lead_paragraph: In corporate America, it may be time to retire the phrase “heir apparent.”

articles.headline: Bond Buyers Are Losing Confidence
articles.snippet: Investors and analysts say the large write-downs of mortgage securities by Citigroup and Merrill Lynch have unnerved the debt markets.
articles.abstract: Investors and analysts say the large write-downs of mortgage securities by Citigroup and Merrill Lynch have unnerved the debt markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a recuperative October, investors in the credit markets are starting to feel a familiar sense of dread.

articles.headline: A Detour From a Battle Against Terror
articles.snippet: While Gen. Pervez Musharraf justified his emergency rule decree as helping him combat terrorism, it could end up weakening his ability and generating instability.
articles.abstract: While Gen. Pervez Musharraf justified his emergency rule decree as helping him combat terrorism, it could end up weakening his ability and generating instability.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Nov. 5 — While Gen. Pervez Musharraf justified his emergency rule decree as helping him combat terrorism, it could end up weakening his ability to rein in the Qaeda militants who ultimately threaten American interests.

articles.headline: Giuliani Says Successes Surpass Kerik’s Mistakes
articles.snippet: Former Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani said that the crime-fighting successes of the disgraced former New York City police commissioner, Bernard B. Kerik, outweighed his legal problems.
articles.abstract: Former Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani said that the crime-fighting successes of the disgraced former New York City police commissioner, Bernard B. Kerik, outweighed his legal problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: Former Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani said yesterday that the crime-fighting successes of the disgraced former police commissioner, Bernard B. Kerik, outweighed his legal problems, and added that “if I have the same degree of success and failure as president of the United States, this country will be in great shape.”

articles.headline: Google Enters the Wireless World
articles.snippet: Google said Monday that it is leading a broad industry effort to develop new software technologies aimed at turning cellphones into powerful mobile computers.
articles.abstract: Google said Monday that it is leading a broad industry effort to develop new software technologies aimed at turning cellphones into powerful mobile computers.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 5 — What Apple began with its iPhone, Google is hoping to accelerate, with an ambitious plan to transform the software at the heart of cellphones.
articles.byline: By Miguel Helft and John Markoff

articles.headline: At Time Warner, Successor to Parsons Emerges
articles.snippet: After months of speculation, Time Warner said that Jeffrey L. Bewkes, the chief operating officer, will succeed Richard D. Parsons as chief executive at the end of the year.
articles.abstract: After months of speculation, Time Warner said that Jeffrey L. Bewkes, the chief operating officer, will succeed Richard D. Parsons as chief executive at the end of the year.
articles.lead_paragraph: After months of speculation, Time Warner announced yesterday that Jeffrey L. Bewkes, the chief operating officer, will succeed Richard D. Parsons as chief executive at the end of the year.
articles.byline: By David Carr and Brian Stelter

articles.headline: Waning Support Led to Ouster of Citigroup Chief
articles.snippet: The end game of Charles O. Prince III’s career at Citigroup probably began with a flight to Saudi Arabia last week by the firm’s former chairman, Sanford I. Weill.
articles.abstract: The end game of Charles O. Prince III’s career at Citigroup probably began with a flight to Saudi Arabia last week by the firm’s former chairman, Sanford I. Weill.
articles.lead_paragraph: As recently as last month, Charles O. Prince III could count on the support of Prince Walid bin Talal of Saudi Arabia, the biggest shareholder of Citigroup, the financial behemoth that Mr. Prince had run for four years.

articles.headline: Pakistan Attempts to Crush Protests by Lawyers
articles.snippet: The government of Gen. Pervez Musharraf faced the first signs of concerted resistance to the imposition of emergency rule.
articles.abstract: The government of Gen. Pervez Musharraf faced the first signs of concerted resistance to the imposition of emergency rule.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Nov. 5 — Angry protests by thousands of lawyers in Lahore and other cities on Monday demonstrated the first organized resistance to the emergency rule imposed by the Pakistani president, Gen. Pervez Musharraf. But the abrupt arrests of many of them threatened to weaken their challenge.
articles.byline: By Jane Perlez and David Rohde

articles.headline: White House to Offer Own Plan on Product Safety
articles.snippet: The Bush administration will propose on Tuesday to expand the authority of the federal drug and consumer product safety agencies to inspect and certify imports.
articles.abstract: The Bush administration will propose on Tuesday to expand the authority of the federal drug and consumer product safety agencies to inspect and certify imports.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 — The Bush administration on Tuesday will propose a significant expansion of the authority of the federal drug and consumer product safety agencies to inspect and certify imports, White House and other administration officials said Monday.

articles.headline: Dubious Fees Hit Borrowers in Foreclosures
articles.snippet: Questionable practices among mortgage lenders are coming to light in bankruptcy courts across the nation.
articles.abstract: Questionable practices among mortgage lenders are coming to light in bankruptcy courts across the nation.
articles.lead_paragraph: As record numbers of homeowners default on their mortgages, questionable practices among lenders are coming to light in bankruptcy courts, leading some legal specialists to contend that companies instigating foreclosures may be taking advantage of imperiled borrowers.

articles.headline: Cable Channel Nods to Ratings and Leans Left
articles.snippet: MSNBC executives acknowledged that they were talking to Rosie O’Donnell about a prime-time show.
articles.abstract: MSNBC executives acknowledged that they were talking to Rosie O’Donnell about a prime-time show.
articles.lead_paragraph: Riding a ratings wave from “Countdown With Keith Olbermann,” a program that takes strong issue with the Bush administration, MSNBC is increasingly seeking to showcase its nighttime lineup as a welcome haven for viewers of a similar mind.
